title: Democratic Debate: The Moments That Mattered
text:
WESTERVILLE, Ohio—Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, who has been gaining ground in national and early state polls, got the front-runner treatment at Tuesday’s Democratic presidential debate, with several of her opponents challenging her policy positions after largely giving her a pass in previous debates.

The 12-candidate forum was also the first debate since Sen. Bernie Sanders’s heart attack and since the start of the House’s impeachment inquiry, which has brought scrutiny to the business ties of former Vice President...
description: Elizabeth Warren, who has been gaining ground in national and early state polls, got the front-runner treatment at the Democratic presidential debate, with several of her opponents challenging her policy positions after largely giving her a pass in previous debates.
